description: Relive the first Saturday of the EFL season, with action from the Championship, League One and League Two.
title: EFL LIVE: Relive Championship, League One & League Two action on first Saturday of season
title_page: EFL LIVE: Relive Championship, League One & League Two action on first Saturday of season - BBC Sport
maintext:
That's a wrap
#bbcefl
The first Saturday of the EFL season is in the books and what a Saturday it has been!
Each of the three divisions saw at least one team win by four goals or more on a brilliantly entertaining day.
We've got match reports from all of the games going live on the website now - so stay with us to recap anything you may have missed.
The weekend action isn't over though, not by a long shot.
We've got three more Championship games for you tomorrow, starting with a Midlands derby between last season's beaten play-off finalists Coventry and relegated Leicester City at 12:00 BST.
Hope you can join us then and thanks for your company today!
get involved
Get Involved
Use #bbcefl, text 81111 (UK only - standard message rates apply) or WhatsApp on 03301231826
Anon: Obviously not the best start for Wrexham but there's a whole season ahead in which to learn how to play at this level. Remember Sutton and Forest Green were recipients of similar negative comments early in their first season and they're both doing OK for themselves. As for my team, Blackburn, after an awful and demoralising transfer window I can't help but think maybe we'll be back in League One next season. Who knows, we may play Wrexham opening game...
A football fan being philosophical and not losing their mind on the opening day? Surely not?!
Joy at Home Park
Plymouth 3-1 Huddersfield
Brent Pilnick
BBC Sport at Home Park
The Home Park faithful aren't leaving yet as they loudly hail their heroes.
They've been through the mill today - joy at an early goal, nervousness as the first half wore on and possibly a bit of despair as Huddersfield deservedly equalised.
But having seen one of the finest goals at this ground for many a year before a third soon after, the Argyle faithful are going home happy.
FULL-TIME
Blackburn 2-1 West Brom
Debut goals from Dilan Markanday and Harry Leonard are enough to see Blackburn through in a game of two halves.
It was all Rovers in the games opening 45 minutes and they knocked the Baggies for six with a pair of quick goals.
The visitors came out fighting in the second and got one back through Matthew Phillips but they couldn't find an equaliser and Rovers survive.
FULL-TIME
Watford 4-0 QPR
A dream start to the new season for Watford and an absolute nightmare from QPR who are hammered 4-0 at Vicarage Road.
The Hornets fired in front just 30 seconds after kick-off through Tom Dele-Bashiru and from then the floodgates opened with Imran Louza, Matheus Martins and Vakoun Bayo all finding the net.
Back to the drawing board doesn't seem to be enough for QPR after that showing. Penny for Gareth Ainsworth's thoughts right now.
